line_1: A Letter in Verse would put him in Fits:
line_2: To this I reply'd, You are out of your Wits;

line_1: Irregularly deep and shrill by fits:
line_2: His voice no touch of harmony admits,

line_1: And raves, and prays, and swears by fits,
line_2: As, twing'd with pain, he pensive sits,

line_1: And sobbing struggles with the rising fits:
line_2: She bares her bosom to the wind, and sits,

line_1: Of pride implanted there, some transient fits;
line_2: And though the bride, now freed from school, admits,

line_1: She'll have her will, or have her fits;
She oft, to my Knowledge, has these sullen Fits:
line_2: Says good Neighbour Nevil, You're out of your Wits;

line_1: And nods, and seems to think, by fits.
line_2: Upon a beam aloft he sits,

line_1: An Angel's Hand alone the Pencil fits,
line_2: To mix the Colours, when an Angel sits.

line_1: Are seiz'd with deep prophetick Fits,
line_2: And (tho' not quite beside their Wits)

line_1: Which fills their Heads with rhyming Fits!
While Spouts run clatt'ring o'er the Roof by Fits;
line_2: Box'd in a Chair the Beau impatient sits,
